alert.note: Alert for Charles; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 3:17AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maryland and northern Virginia, including the following counties: in Maryland, Charles and Prince Georges. In northern Virginia, City of Alexandria and Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alexandria... Waldorf... Annandale... Clinton... Springfield... Fort Washington... Fort Hunt... Groveton... Huntington... Fort Belvoir... Woodbridge... National Harbor... Burke... Lincolnia... Lorton... Franconia... Oxon Hill... Hybla Valley... Newington... Friendly... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
